rules: Rule1: Provided that the exhibition is award-winning, it follows that the exhibition is successful.
Rule2: If the artwork is repaired, then it must have been damaged.

Rule3: Provided that the artwork is purchased, if it is not the case that the artwork being visible implies (either the audience is popular or whenever the technology is not functioning, the artwork does not display technology), then the artwork is repaired.

Rule4: If the critic is praised, then whenever it is not the case that the audience is popular or (under the condition that the technology is not functioning, the artwork does not display technology), the artwork is rejected.

Rule5: Under the condition that it is not the case that the exhibition being featured implies (whenever it is not the case that the artwork being visible implies (either the audience is popular or provided that the technology is not functioning, the artwork does not display technology), then the artwork is repaired), the exhibition is not controversial.

Rule6: Provided that it is not the case that (if it is not the case that the exhibition being featured implies (whenever it is not the case that the artwork being visible implies (either the audience is popular or under the condition that the technology is not functioning, the artwork does not display technology), then the artwork is repaired), then the exhibition is controversial), the exhibition is award-winning.
Rule7: If the technology is not functioning, then the artwork displays technology.
facts: Fact5: The exhibition is not successful.
Fact6: The audience is not popular.
Fact7: The artwork is not damaged.
Fact8: The artwork is not rejected.
